# Home
Welcome to MIT Admissions. 
![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/hand.jpg)
Here, you can [explore MIT](https://mitadmissions.org/discover/), learn [how to apply](https://mitadmissions.org/apply/), plan a [visit](https://mitadmissions.org/visit/), read the [blogs](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/), get [help](https://mitadmissions.org/help/) from our staff, or sign up for our [newsletter](https://mitadmissions.org/discover/learn-more/email-newsletters/).
By doing so, we hope you‚Äôll learn more about MIT, but also about yourself.
## Announcements and deadlines
  1. üóìÔ∏è Our [Regular Action deadline](https://mitadmissions.org/apply/firstyear/deadlines-requirements/) has passed. The first-year application is closed in the [portal](https://apply.mitadmissions.org/portal/apply).
  2. üóìÔ∏è The [transfer application deadline](https://mitadmissions.org/apply/transfer/deadlines/) for fall entry is March 1.

###  [ Wanting to Do Everything And Deciding What Parts of Everything I Can Do ](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wanting-to-do-everything/)
    * by [Richard O. '28](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/author/richard/)
    * December 31, 2025
    * [](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wanting-to-do-everything/#disqus_thread)
If I had a penny for every time I heard someone say, ‚Äúthis year went by so fast,‚Äù and other phrases of the sort, I would have a lot of pennies in the month of December. Piles of them. Every single year. But as clich√© as that line‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wanting-to-do-everything/)
[ ![Wanting to Do Everything](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/IMG_1513-scaled-200x200-c-default.jpeg) ](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wanting-to-do-everything/)

###  [ wherever you go, there you are alive internet theory ](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wherever-you-go-there-you-are/)
    * by [Kayode D. '27](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/author/kayode/)
    * December 30, 2025
    * [](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wherever-you-go-there-you-are/#disqus_thread)
Where to go from here? To be sincere, I didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd make it near. My twenty second year some life I‚Äôve engineered to the good for all my peers. Did you know it snows up there? Nothing like the Vegas scene, but you‚Äôre still you. Can‚Äôt run away from‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/wherever-you-go-there-you-are/)
  * ![An illustration of Allison's profile. She has light skin, shoulder-length wavy brown hair and is wearing a striped maroon shirt with a necklace.](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Allison-150x150.jpg)
###  [ Life in the Fast Lane why do i walk so fast? ](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/life-in-the-fast-lane/)
    * by [Allison E. '27](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/author/allisone/)
    * December 29, 2025
    * [](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/life-in-the-fast-lane/#disqus_thread)
People at MIT walk fast. Maybe this is an east coast thing, maybe it‚Äôs a college student thing, maybe it‚Äôs just an ‚ÄúI grew up in laid-back Hawaii and anything would feel faster than home‚Äù thing, but it feels like undergrads walk faster here. The‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/life-in-the-fast-lane/)


### Recharging a campus tradition
![Two students building a structure.](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Jan26-NEET-400x225.jpg)
In a project-based climate and sustainability engineering class, [students designed and constructed a solar-powered charging station on campus](https://news.mit.edu/2025/neet-scholars-install-solar-powered-charging-station-1209 "https://news.mit.edu/2025/neet-scholars-install-solar-powered-charging-station-1209"), delivering renewable energy while reinvigorating MIT's ethos of [learning by doing](https://elo.mit.edu/ "https://elo.mit.edu/").
### Setting sail for a global education
![Students overlooking a net on water.](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Jan26-MISTI-150x150.jpg)
Through [MIT International Science and Technology Initiatives (MISTI)](https://misti.mit.edu/ "https://misti.mit.edu/") internships, students like Beckett D. '26 and Tony T. '27 are able to take their work beyond campus.
### Giving back through FSILG communities
![Students talking in a hallway.](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Jan26-FSILG-e1767734939668-150x150.jpg)
More than 35% of MIT undergraduates belong to the Institute's network of [Fraternities, Sororities, and Independent Living Groups (FSILGs)](https://studentlife.mit.edu/campus-communities/fraternities-sororities-and-independent-living-groups/ "https://studentlife.mit.edu/campus-communities/fraternities-sororities-and-independent-living-groups/") ‚Äî 43 vibrant communities rooted in 143 years of civic engagement, leadership, and philanthropy.

the end of a semester at MIT is a time of juxtaposition. it is a time of delight and sadness, of triumph and melancholia; it is a fast time and a slow time; it is a time of midnight doomerism and late afternoon euphoria, of frivolity and sudden‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/tick-tock-tick-tock/)

###  [ MIT Early Action Decisions Now Available Online ](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/mit-early-action-decisions-now-available-online-2025/)
    * by [Chris Peterson SM '13](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/author/petey/)
    * December 16, 2025
    * [](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/mit-early-action-decisions-now-available-online-2025/#disqus_thread)
MIT Early Action admissions decisions for the Class of 2030 are now available in the application portal. To check your decision, login to the portal and visit your Application Status page. There, you will be able to see your decision by clicking View‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/mit-early-action-decisions-now-available-online-2025/)
  * ![Decisions](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/avatar_24-150x150.png)

YOU! GOT! IN! Come hang out with us in the comments, you all star! And‚Äîmore importantly‚Äîcelebrate with your community and loved ones. It won‚Äôt be long now until we get to meet you in the Class of 2030 Discord or at‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/open-thread-admitted-early-2025/)

###  [ Open Thread: Deferred Early ](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/open-thread-deferred-early-2025/)
    * by [Decisions](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/author/decisions/)
    * December 16, 2025
    * [](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/open-thread-deferred-early-2025/#disqus_thread)
If your decision was deferred, then we will reconsider your application anew and without prejudice in Regular Action. Understandably, you may have some questions, so we‚Äôve assembled some answers to FAQs. Many MIT students were initially deferred; you can read some of their experiences here, ‚Ä¶ [Read More](https://mitadmissions.org/blogs/entry/open-thread-deferred-early-2025/)

‚ÄúOh well, what's life without a few dragons?‚Äù - Ron Weasley
‚ÄúOnly those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.‚Äù - T.S. Eliot
‚ÄúIt is invaluable to have a friend who shares your interests and helps you stay motivated.‚Äú - Maryam Mirzakhani
‚ÄúAll sorts of things can happen when you‚Äôre open to new ideas.‚Äù   
- Stephanie Kwolek
‚ÄúAlmost nothing important that ever happens to you happens because you engineer it.‚Äù - David Foster Wallace 
‚ÄúThe only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it.‚Äù   
- Alan Watts 
‚ÄúIn this world simplicity and kindness are the only magic wands that work wonders.‚Äù - L. Frank Baum 
‚ÄúPeople who deny the existence of dragons are often eaten by dragons.‚Äù   
- Ursula K Le Guin
‚ÄúThe universe is wider than our views of it.‚Äù - Henry David Thoreau 
‚ÄúNever hack alone.‚Äù - Jack Florey
‚ÄúOffering help is courageous and compassionate, but so is asking for help.‚Äù - Bren√© Brown
‚ÄúAll grown-ups were once children, but only a few of them remember it.‚Äù   
- Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry
‚ÄúOur histories cling to us. We are shaped by where we come from.‚Äù   
- Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
‚ÄúMaybe you have to know the darkness before you can appreciate the light.‚Äù - Madeleine L'Engle
‚ÄúWhere there's music there can be no evil.‚Äù - Miguel de Cervantes
## From the community
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2026/01/Transistor.jpg) New materials could boost efficiency of microelectronics By stacking multiple active components based on new materials on the back end of a computer chip, this new approach reduces the amount of energy wasted during computation. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/new-materials-could-boost-energy-efficiency-microelectronics-1211)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/12/MIT-ArtificialTendons-01-press_0.jpg) Artificial tendons give muscle-powered robots a boost The new design from MIT engineers could pump up many biohybrid builds. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/artificial-tendons-give-muscle-powered-robots-boost-1201)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/MIT-Marco-Graffiedi.jpg) Using physical phenomena to solve problems Marco Graffiedi, a doctoral student in nuclear science and engineering, is researching quenching processes to help cool nuclear cores. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/using-classic-physical-phenomena-solve-new-problems-marco-graffiedi-1031)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/10/BeaconofLight-1000x841.png) A beacon of light A lantern created in the Design Intelligence Lab creates sustainable alternatives for consumer electronics. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/beacon-of-light-geolectric-lantern-0929)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/09/MIT_Battery-Recycling.jpg) Recyclable EV batteries MIT researchers designed an electrolyte that can break apart at the end of a battery‚Äôs life, allowing for easier recycling of components. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/new-self-assembling-material-could-be-key-recyclable-ev-batteries-0828)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/MIT-Semiconductor-Properties-01_0.jpg) Robotic probe Developed to analyze new semiconductors, the system could streamline the development of more powerful solar panels. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/robotic-probe-quickly-measures-key-properties-new-materials-0704)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/07/SabrinaCorsettiLab.png) Integrated photonics Sabrina Corsetti builds photonic devices that manipulate light to enable the previously unimaginable, like pocket-sized 3D printers. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/sabrina-corsetti-explores-high-tech-wizardry-integrated-photonics-0702)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/MagneticBreakthrough.png) Magnetic Breakthrough MIT physicists have observed a new form of magnetism that could offer a path to ‚Äúspintronic‚Äù memory devices.  ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/physicists-observe-new-form-magnetism-0605)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/05/calligraphy-bot.jpg) Art meets science Designed and built by Gloria Z. '26 and Lee L. '26, this calligraphy machine has a way with words. ](https://www.technologyreview.com/2025/02/14/1111224/calligraphy-bot/)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/03/MITSeaPerch.png) An underwater robot with a mission Developed by MIT Sea Grant, SeaPerch is a maker project that provides an approachable path for middle and high school students to learn more about sensors, robotics, climate science, and more. ](https://youtu.be/iTNzBFul4C8?si=vEXp-uQ--TIFYW10)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/Woodie_Flowers_MechE_video-1000x743.png) Engineering joy Watch as MechE remembers the late Dr. Woodie Flowers who led the way for hands-on engineering education at MIT and spread the joy of designing and building things to students‚Äînot only on campus but around the world. ](https://youtu.be/afdtJ99CGOI?si=wX_yypoaJ9m4s5nX)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/MIT-Luca-Carlone_SPARK-Lab.jpg) Robot research MIT AeroAstro associate professor Luca Carlone and his students in the SPARK Lab are working to expand a robot‚Äôs awareness of its environment in ways that approach human-level perception. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/expanding-robot-perception-luca-carlone-0128)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2025/01/CoffeeClass_MIT.jpg) Blending coffee and science In class 3.000 (Coffee Matters: Using the Breakerspace to Make the Perfect Cup), students explore coffee chemistry and what makes a good brew through hands-on experiments. ](https://news.mit.edu/2025/coffee-fix-mit-students-decode-science-behind-perfect-cup-0107)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Educating-the-Whole-Student_MIT.png) ‚ÄúThe Whole Student Experience‚Äù The latest issue of Spectrum delves into what it means to educate the whole student at MIT. ](https://betterworld.mit.edu/spectrum/issues/2024-fall/)
[ ![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/11/MIT_Rhea_Vedro.jpg) Mind and hand Rhea Vedro, a technical instructor of metalsmithing, aims to transform the lives of her students through the art of making. ](https://news.mit.edu/2024/fusing-science-culture-through-metalsmithing-rhea-vedro-1029)

![](https://mitadmissions.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/Dome-Inverted-1-e1537802370803-400x222.png) [MIT Admissions](https://mitadmissions.org/)
At MIT Admissions, we recruit and enroll a talented and diverse class of undergraduates who will learn to use science, technology, and other areas of scholarship to serve the nation and the world in the 21st century.
